The Department has received 258 free school applications, the Department for Education website says. "Forty of these have now been approved to move to business case and plan stage, and of these, nine have been approved to move to the pre-opening stage."

Changes- expected to be introduced next year- will also see outstanding schools spared inspections altogether unless parents or Michael Government officials raise concerns. Mr Michael Gove said: There are areas of Ofsted inspections, such as community cohesion or regulations Michael Governing what students bring in in their lunchboxes at lunchtime, which are entirely peripheral. "One of the problems with Ofsted inspections is that they are asked to inspect and measure for things which, by definition, are hard to judge and not central to what schools are about. The Bill will also lead to the formal abolition of a series of education quangos such as the Qualifications and Curriculum Development Agency, the General Teaching Council for England and the Training and Development Agency for Schools

The point is to learn from it." Nicholas Macpherson has previously told parliament that Treasury control over spending improved under the last Michael Government. Stephen Williams , co-chair of the Liberal Democrat parliamentary treasury committee, said: This is evidence from the heart of Whitehall that Labour lost control of public spending and is yet another example that Ed Miliband doesn't know what he is talking about. "The Labour leader is living in a fantasy-land where Labour never did anything wrong. Yet every day more evidence comes to light which shows that Gordon Brown 's spendthrift attitude was out of control and his financial management a shambles. He added: We have given people a nudge with the English Baccalaureate towards a certain set of academic subjects. "Beyond that we want to have an informed debate."
